My bit gold design in 1998 was 2-layer: bit gold for settlement, Chaumian e-cash for a privacy-enhanced payments layer. I've always thought of Bitcoin as evolving into a settlements-and-large-payments layer that in the long term needed a layer 2 for consumer payments.

Crucial point. "Digital cash" was dreamed up by academic cryptographers long before Bitcoin. It was a privacy-enhanced way to pay in dollars or euro, not a new currency. 1/ I used to be a big night person, in fact I learnt about # Bitcoin in an IRC chat room around 3am. I would wake up late in the day and stay awake into the wee hours of the night. I used to think this was production, but prison changed that.

Gambling was one of the primary uses of Bitcoin, we had satoshi dice back in the day, people loved it, I never used it since I'm not that kind of a gambler. It's a solid use case. I personally would also love to see more games and other things but people want what they want.
